summary: A CyberTipline report submitted to the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children (NCMEC) on August 30, 2019, alleging a woman from South Bend, Indiana, is involved in sex trafficking with Jeffrey Epstein, international drug trafficking, money laundering, and corruption of local law enforcement. The report was processed by NCMEC's Child Sex Trafficking Team and forwarded to the FBI.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named by the reporting person as being involved in sex trafficking with the primary subject of the report. NCMEC notes it has received multiple previous reports about him.

events.title: CyberTipline Report Submission
events.description: An anonymous report is submitted to NCMEC alleging a complex web of criminal activity including sex trafficking, drug trafficking, money laundering, and corruption in South Bend, Indiana, with a link to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: NCMEC Processing and FBI Referral
events.description: NCMEC's Child Sex Trafficking Team processes the report, conducts deconfliction searches, and forwards it to the FBI's Innocence Lost program.

keyFacts: An anonymous tip alleges a woman from South Bend, IN, is involved in sex trafficking with Jeffrey Epstein, international cocaine dealing, and money laundering.
The tipster claims the subject has corrupted local South Bend law enforcement and FBI, and requests investigation by an outside 'specialist team' from Washington.
The report is disjointed and difficult to understand, according to the NCMEC analyst's note.
NCMEC processed the report, found previous unrelated reports on Jeffrey Epstein, and forwarded it to the FBI's Innocence Lost program.
The reporting person's IP address was traced to a Comcast residential connection in the South Bend-Elkhart, Indiana area.
